title: OGsmall
author: OGsmall
content: Yes some how I agree with them because a lot is going wrong in the country This is Nigeria were you see animals eat money, Nigeria is a place people do a lot of things bad roads and corruption has taking all over, but still on still as the matter be we all still dey believe on change of the country, come wetin u think?? u don ever think am

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Many people will complain about Nigeria because we are in the era that people prefer to depend on government than themselves. They want the government to do everything for them. To provide to good job, and if possible, to subsidize some products and services.In Nigeria, you will see people from poor background that become rich and become well known in his town. If that is still possible, it means many people will complain, but some people will still live a good life. As some people are complaining, in the same Nigeria some people are earning on foreign currencies like United States dollar and some people are still living comfortably.Some people will not just get it but be complaining and explaining how a situation is. Yes, I agree to the fact that Nigeria economy and standard of living is poor.

comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: People have absolutely lost hope in our government due to devastating news people hear everyday from insecurity cases to economic stagnation and things had keep on being difficult for the common person why the rich gets richer the common man is struggling to survive.It is very sad that our government has neglected the voice of the masses they no longer put the interest of the masses in consideration, they take decisions without knowing the effects on her citizen.Just take a look at our electoral system, Even when the masses turn up in mass to elect their leaders, they will overturn everything to their favor without even thinking of the repercussion of their decisions. Imagine a country where a presidential aspirant will tell the country that it is his turn to rule. So Nigeria has now become a family inheritance whereby people now think that there are certain groups of person that should be rotating the leadership of the country.Imagine some government officials now take leadership as a permanent contract that they will remain in office for a very long time without allowing others to participate in leadership. Now what is the fate of the younger generation like is it when they will get old that they will take part in the leadership of the country? Things keeps getting worst everyday from one sad news to the other no one will be happy in such situation.Inasmuch as people are also making efforts to make things work in this country, our government should also put her citizen in consideration when taking decisions that will affect her citizens. Everyone hopes to live a good life and a good environment so a situation where a citizen feels that their country isn't conducive for them again they will literally begin to lament about their country.

comments.body: Omor... Is like na only me no see am like this oh, I be proudly Nigerian no matter what dey do.One attribute of Human is the ability to adapt to even unfavorable conditions, even at such level of corruption in this country there is always a time for change most countries doing well today are older than Nigeria and they all went through this process of corruption, I call this the process of change. comments.author: Out of mind
comments.body: It's regrettable for anyone too be born in Nigeria today, because most of the problems in the country are related. Economically not promising and most of the people are suffering here causing the most problems in the country. Also, if you look at different parts of my country, people are not getting food, clothing, shelter. Every day a large number of people beg on the streets just to provide themselves with food, but here it is seen that the government does not take any action towards it. People don't have shelter All in all the poor people of our country are facing most of the problems, and they are suffering a lot due too lack of food, still the government is not doing anything about it. That is why we should inform the government about these issues and the leaders who are in the area must take good steps for these poor people. If the government takes all these steps and resolves everything, then surely Nigeria can be a well-developed country and move ahead economically in the future.

comments.author: Miles2006
comments.body: Abi you no dey see how the country dey. Nobody go tell me say this inflation and the current situation wey naija dey no dey affect am, proud Nigerian or not, dependent or independent, business man or salary earner, naija current situation dey affect everybody, naija just dey fucked up for now and I no dey blame anybody wey dey talk bad about Nigeria. But observe people wey dey complain naija dey in many faces. the jobless ones wey no wan make effort to do anything, them think say everything na government go provide na why sometimes wey flood come them go blame government lol, government don suffer. business men: even this naija current situation dey affect business men too. For example the price of fuel, some business dey wey involve light, and them go need to buy fuel daily because the electricity system for naija na another problem. And business men dey short for money due to the price of fuel currently. salary earner/civil servants: due to the inflation in naija, price of things don increase and no upgradment of civil servants pay, but things dey expensive, sometimes month never end money don finish.Even me wey dey talk the country tire me because I go buy something today for market the next week price don increase, and the thing dey amaze me sometimes I go dey wonder. But we still dey manage for the country.

comments.body: I wouldn't blame anybody that feels Nigeria is not good for them because truly our system has failed us woefully and because of that, people has already lost hope on them. How can a country that's blessed as Nigeria cannot empower there youth or create an avenue were people could showcased there skills and things they have read I'm the school. Every sector in our government is corrupt, and cost of living is getting higher by the day, imagine small things we normally buy for 500 naira is now more than 2k and so many persons even finds it difficult to have a square meal a day due to hardship and even the price of commodities the federal government are supposed to work on by introducing price control policy so that things will be a bit easy but they're not doing anything about it.

comments.author: Forever101
comments.body: If anyone thinks Nigeria is hard, I think the person is yet to appreciate the goodness of God to be a Nigerian. To be sincere with ourselves, Nigeria is hard now but there  is no point regretting being a Nigerian,  there are countries that are more difficult than Nigeria but there media keep saying good about them. We have seen people who travelled out who later testify that Nigeria is better than other places. I have some person who just returned from Ghana and when I ask them about the situation there, they confess that Nigeria is 100% better. The difference between us and other countries are the media. As for us we take everything out to world why for others they covered their story.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: There is no better country than your country, but because the Citizens are not being carried along by the government, it now seems like being a Citizen of Nigeria is a thing of regret, our politicians have turned Nigeria into a government only for the Rich people, and the poor masses are being neglected and not taken care of, and now their target is the middle class, with the current hike in fuel price would push a lot of middle class into poverty line so that they will have opportunity to do whatever they want without anybody questioning them.However, despite all their efforts in trying to do this, they have even made a lot of people become self-dependent without having to rely on our government for survival.

comments.author: Versatile_choice
comments.body: Considering all the things that has been happening in this country nobody will be happy, we no that no country is perfect but at least the well being of there citizens should be there major priority but in the case of Nigerian government noting like that when we have all the resources that can take care of everyone but instead all they care for is only there pockets. If you check very well you will see that millions of people are graduating from school every year and no employment nothing to empower the youth, when the reason for going to school is to become a successful man in the future and spending years in school you come back home to start from square one, who will not be angry at the government, we have not even talk about the high cost of living in the country were the average man find it difficult to have a two square meal a day.

comments.body: Quote from: OGsmall on October 20, 2023, 11:10:36 AMYes some how I agree with them because a lot is going wrong in the country This is Nigeria were you see animals eat money, Nigeria is a place people do a lot of things bad roads and corruption has taking all over, but still on still as the matter be we all still dey believe on change of the country, come wetin u think?? u don ever think am Though Naija may be said to be corrupt, but it's still far better than others.  Though our Naija may be said to have bad government who do not care about the welfare of it's citizens, but yet we still have people hustling to survive despite all odds.So whatever people may be passing through in this country Naija, I don't think that's enough reason for people to say it is a mistake to be citizen of our dear nation, because nobody chose to be born in this nation, and as such, it is our sole responsibility to make things right where people are getting it wrong, instead of condemning or complaining, because I believe that with a collective effort, we can make this nation great again. So hence, it's never a mistake to be born in our dear nation.
